data.title: Automotive Technology Insight
data.meta_description: News, analysis and forecasts for the automotive supply chain.
data.text:
Making waves in the autonomous driving industry: Wayve’s funding splash

Wayve's recent funding represents the largest AI fundraising in the UK to date. One notable aspect of Wayve's approach to automated/autonomous driving technology is its focus on empowering a variety of manufacturers through its 'Embodied AI' technology. Unlike many competitors that rely heavily on high-definition maps and pre-programmed routes, Wayve utilizes a machine learning model that learns from vast amounts of data, simulating human learning. This adaptability enables Wayve's system to han...

Navigating compliance costs: OEMs' dilemma in making legacy vehicles compliant with cybersecurity

The implementation of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) R155 cybersecurity regulation has ramifications for the automotive industry that are more immediate than one would ordinarily expect in the vehicle planning process. It has led to some shuffling of vehicle portfolios among original equipment manufacturers due to inputting cost-benefit scenarios into the vehicle planning process. Porsche's decision to discontinue sales of the internal combustion engine (ICE)-powered M...

UL Solutions acquires TesTneT to strengthen hydrogen technology expertise

UL Solutions has announced the acquisition of TesTneT Engineering, a Germany-based company specializing in hydrogen component and system testing. The acquisition is a strategic move by UL Solutions to expand its expertise in alternative fuels, thereby enhancing its ability to contribute to global decarbonization efforts. The deal was completed on July 8. However, the two parties have not disclosed the financial details of the acquisition. Founded in 2009, TesTneT provides comprehensive t...

Seeing Machines acquires Asaphus and partners with Valeo

As reported in a press release on July 8, Seeing Machines has recently acquired the Berlin-based company Asaphus, a move announced alongside a strategic collaboration with Valeo, a prominent figure in the automotive industry. The partnership aims to fortify their stance in the driver and occupant monitoring systems market. As part of the agreement, Valeo will transfer its driver monitoring perception software activity, stemming from its acquisition of Asaphus, to Seeing Machines. This is intende...

Renesas and Altium obtain US approval for merger

Renesas Electronics Corp., known for its advanced semiconductor solutions, and Altium, recognized for its electronics design systems, have jointly announced receiving final approval from the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States for their proposed merger, as reported in a press release July 1. This authorization, received July 1, marks the clearance of the last regulatory hurdle required to proceed with the merger, following approvals from authorities in Australia, Germany, Tur...

Rane Holdings to acquire full ownership of Rane NSK Steering Systems

The board of directors of India-based automotive supplier Rane Holdings has approved the company’s decision to acquire the remaining 51% stake in Rane NSK Steering Systems from its Japanese partner NSK for 450 million Indian rupees ($5.4 million), Autocar Professional reported July 1. This acquisition will make Rane NSK Steering Systems a wholly owned subsidiary of Rane Holdings, subsequently leading to its renaming as Rane Steering Systems. The completion of this acquisition is anticipated by...

GlobalFoundries acquires Tagore Technology’s GaN instrument panel portfolio

GlobalFoundries (GF) announced the acquisition of Tagore Technology's Power Gallium Nitride (GaN) IP portfolio, as reported in a press release July 1. This acquisition marks a significant expansion of GF's power management solutions, especially in high-power density applications critical to the automotive and other sectors. The addition of Tagore Technology's GaN technology underscores GF's commitment to advancing power efficiency and performance as digital technologies, particularly Generative ...

Renesas completes acquisition of Transphorm to enhance power semiconductor offerings

Renesas Electronics has completed the previously announced acquisition of Transphorm, a US-based company specializing in gallium nitride (GaN) power semiconductors, the Japanese supplier said in a press release June 20. The acquisition allows Renesas to expand its offerings to include GaN-based power products and related reference designs, responding to the increasing demand for wide bandgap semiconductor (WBG) products. WBG materials like GaN and silicon carbide (SiC) are essential for next-...

Hyundai acquires Hyundai Mobis' Hydrogen Fuel-Cell Business

Hyundai Motor has acquired the Hydrogen Fuel-Cell Business of Hyundai Mobis to accelerate technological innovation and product development, The Korea Herald reported June 9. The acquisition, completed last month, brings together hydrogen fuel-cell facilities, assets and personnel from the two companies. Following the acquisition, Hyundai Motor has established a new process quality unit under its Research and Development Division's hydrogen fuel-cell development center to strengthen the orga...

Lumileds agrees to divest Lamps and Accessories business for $238 million

Lumileds has agreed to sell its Lamps and Accessories business to First Brands Group, an international automotive parts manufacturer, for $238 million. First Brands will continue to broaden its global services and establish its products and brands in the automotive accessories sector. The sale is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2024. Lumileds will transfer its automotive lamp factories in mainland China, Germany and Poland with the Lamps and Accessories business to the ...

Munich-based Qwello acquires Dutch charge-point operator Park & Charge

Munich-based electric vehicle charging infrastructure company Qwello has acquired Dutch charge-point operator (CPO) Park & Charge, which was established in 2016 and is active in about 200 municipalities in the Netherlands, according to a news report published by Electrive on May 13. The report said that post-acquisition, Qwello will manage more than 12,000 EV charging points installed in 300 municipalities across seven countries in Europe. It further said that Park & Charge’s existi...

Quest Global acquires majority stake in People Tech Group

Quest Global has acquired a majority stake in People Tech Group, it said in a press release dated May 7. The partnership will expand Quest Global's footprint in North America within the automotive and hi-tech industries. People Tech brings extensive expertise in digital transformation for software-defined vehicles (SDVs), architecture, design, development, and testing of human-machine interface (HMI) and applications for infotainment systems and instrument clusters, as well as software...

Sogefi to close sale of its Filtration business unit to Pacific Avenue Capital Partners by end-May

Milan-based supplier of air management, engine cooling and suspension systems Sogefi Group expects to close the sale of its Filtration business unit to the US private equity fund Pacific Avenue Capital Partners by the end of May, the company said May 6. Providing an update on the transaction, the company said that the sale and purchase agreement has already been agreed upon between both the parties and will be executed in the upcoming days. In a press note issued, Sogefi said that it has a...

ICAP Group acquires Valeo's Ferentino site

Valeo and ICAP Group have signed an agreement to take over Ferentino Automotive Transition Srl in Italy, according to a press release dated May 7. ICAP Group will acquire Ferentino Automotive Transition, the Valeo subsidiary that owns the Ferentino site. This move is part of ICAP Group's plan to expand its presence in the growing industry of sustainable collective mobility, where it is already a key player with its subsidiary Tecnobus, an Italian manufacturer of electric minibuses. “We are ...

Craftsman to acquire remaining 24% stake in DR Axion India Pvt. Ltd.

Craftsman Automation Ltd., an Indian manufacturer of machined powertrain components, has announced the acquisition of the remaining 24% stake in DR Axion India Pvt. Ltd. (DRAIPL), a subsidiary it acquired 76% of in February 2023. The acquisition is expected to be completed by June 30, 2024. The move aims to strengthen Craftsman's presence in the passenger vehicle segment and enter the e-mobility solutions market through process synergies, access to DRAIPL's customer base and technological col...

Forvia completes acquisition of Faurecia Aptoide Automotive

Forvia has completed the acquisition of the remaining 50% shares from Aptoide in the joint venture Faurecia Aptoide Automotive (FAA), it said in a press release dated May 2. Forvia assumes full ownership of the 2019-established JV. The FAA Apps Market Platform provides security, privacy, flexibility and content control, with the option to customize its look and feel, as well as the apps portfolio. All the apps offered by FAA are tested and validated for automotive purposes. Notable apps offer...

KPIT completes acquisition of auto software company PathPartner

KPIT has announced it completed the acquisition of PathPartner Technology, according to a company press release dated April 19. PathPartner offers design, service and solution for operating system software and low-level software for automotive, camera, radar and multimedia devices. The cost of acquisition of 100% stake of PathPartner is about 1.91 billion rupees (about $22.9 million). With extensive expertise in embedded operating systems, low-level processor architectures, hardware-accelerat...

Solero Technologies acquires Kendrion's automotive business in Europe and US

Atar Capital has announced that Solero Technologies has signed an agreement to acquire Kendrion's automotive business in Europe and the US, in a press release dated April 15. The transaction, which is expected to close in the third quarter of 2024, is valued at about $70 million and includes trailing 12 months (TTM) EBITDA of approximately $24.1 million, representing approximately 80% of Kendrion's Automotive business. Solero Technologies will effectuate the transaction with support from Atar Ca...

Microchip acquires advanced driver assistance system and digital cockpit connectivity company VSI

Microchip Technology has announced the completed acquisition of Seoul, South Korea-based VSI Co. Ltd., a provider of high-speed, asymmetric, camera, sensor and display connectivity technologies and products based on the Automotive SerDes Alliance (ASA) open standard for in-vehicle networking (IVN). The terms of the transaction are not disclosed, as reported in a press release on April 11. “This acquisition brings VSI’s knowledgeable team, their market traction and ASA Motion Link [A...

Continental acquires EMT, strengthening tire-mold production capabilities

Continental, a leading tire manufacturer, has acquired EMT s.r.o., a mold manufacturing specialist based in Puchov, Slovakia. The acquisition was completed on April 2, with all shares of EMT being transferred to Continental. The agreement was reached with EMT's shareholders, with Dynamic Design (Romania) being the majority shareholder, a company press release dated April 8 said. All 107 employees of EMT, who possess specialist knowledge in mold manufacturing, have been taken on by Continental...

Betamek acquires Sanshin to expand its automotive electronics portfolio

Betamek Bhd. has entered into a share purchase agreement with Outsourcing Inc. to acquire Sanshin (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd. for a cash consideration set at RM13.4 million (about $2.8 million), it said in a press release on April 1. Sanshin manufactures car audios and other electronics components, serving markets in Malaysia, Japan, Hong Kong and Thailand. This acquisition will position Sanshin as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Betamek, expanding Betamek's customer base. The acquisition wil...

Mahle and Forvia Hella complete the sale of their shares in JV BHTC

Mahle Behr GmbH & Co. KG, a subsidiary of Mahle Group (Mahle), and Hella GmbH & Co. KGaA (Forvia Hella) completed the sale of their respective 50% stake in the joint venture Behr-Hella Thermocontrol (BHTC) to AUO Corp., the company said in a press release on April 2. The parties had signed an agreement to sell the shares on Oct. 2, 2023; the transaction has now been approved by the relevant authorities. The total purchase price is based on an enterprise value of €600 million. ...

Toyota Boshoku accepts investment for TB Kawashima to strengthen automotive seat fabric business

Toyota Boshoku Corp. has announced that it will accept a capital investment from Aunde Achter & Ebels GmbH in its consolidated subsidiary, TB Kawashima Co. Ltd., in a press release dated March 28. As a result, Toyota Boshoku's voting rights ratio in TB Kawashima will decrease to 20%, and TB Kawashima will become an equity method affiliate company. The investment is expected to strengthen TB Kawashima's competitiveness and enhance its new product development capabilities. Aunde, which has ...

ZF Rane Automotive India acquires TRW Sun Steering Wheels to expand safety capabilities

ZF Rane Automotive India, a joint venture between ZF Group and Rane Group, has acquired 100% of TRW Sun Steering Wheels (TSSW), a steering wheel manufacturer based in Gurugram, India. With this acquisition, ZF Rane Automotive India aims to expand its capabilities and provide comprehensive solutions for occupant safety and system integration services to its domestic customers. The acquisition will also strategically strengthen the company's position in west and north India. Harish Lakshman, vi...

Panasonic plans to sell Automotive Business to Apollo Global-managed funds

Japan's Panasonic Holdings said it will sell its entire stake in Panasonic Automotive Systems (PAS) to funds managed by US private equity firm Apollo Global Management, and then make an investment in the new holding entity, US News reported March 29, quoting a Reuters report. The transaction has a total enterprise value of ¥311 billion (about $2.06 billion), subject to adjustments at closing, which is expected by the end of the first quarter of 2025, Apollo said in a statement. Panasonic ...

Siemens to acquire industrial drive technology business of ebm-papst

According to a press release on March 21, Siemens has agreed to acquire the IDT portfolio of ebm-papst, a German company specializing in industrial drive technology. The acquisition is expected to generate significant business potential in the areas of flexible and autonomous factory automation, with the integration of IDT's portfolio into Siemens' existing automation portfolio. The transaction is subject to foreign trade and merger control approvals and is expected to be completed by mid-2025. ...

Maruti Suzuki to acquire 6.44% stake in startup Amlgo Labs

Maruti Suzuki India has agreed to acquire an equity stake of 6.44% in Amlgo Labs, a technology-led startup. The Amlgo Labs is a fast-growing data solutions company providing end-to-end Technical Implementation/Advisory and support for Analytics, cloud, engineering, ML/AI &' and reporting solutions. The company plans to invest in Amlgo Labs' equity shares to enhance its data-driven decision-making and customer offerings. Amlgo Labs will allot 689 equity shares of Rs 10 each, at a premium o...

Naxnova acquires Quad Industries Belgium to expand its market presence and offerings

Naxnova, a design and technology company, has acquired Quad Industries Belgium, a leading player in the printed electronics sector, for rupees 0.9 billion ($10.08 million). This acquisition marks a strategic move for Naxnova as it expands its market presence and solidifies its offering. Quad Industries Belgium develops and manufactures user interfaces and other printed solutions for various sectors, including medical, wearables, consumer goods, and automotive. The acquisition brings together ...

Rheinmetall acquires Dutch startup REEQ

Rheinmetall AG, a leading German supplier of automotive components and technologies, has acquired the Dutch startup REEQ, thereby expanding its vehicle portfolio to include innovative light hybrid vehicles, the company announced on March 18. “At the beginning of March 2024, the technology group's Dutch subsidiary Rheinmetall Defence Nederland B.V., which is part of the Vehicle Systems Division, acquired 100% of the shares in the Dutch start-up REEQ,” the company said, adding that the stra...

Synopsys expands semiconductor IP portfolio with acquisition of Intrinsic ID

Synopsys has acquired Intrinsic ID, a provider of Physical Unclonable Function (PUF) IP. The acquisition adds PUF IP to Synopsys' broad semiconductor IP portfolio, enabling designers to protect their systems-on-chips (SoCs) by generating a unique identifier on chip using the inherent and distinctive characteristics of every silicon chip, according to a March 20 press release. "In our increasingly connected world, chip designers are integrating PUF technology in their SoCs for many application...

Samvardhana Motherson’s unit MSSL Mideast to acquire Yachiyo India Manufacturing

On March 19, Samvardhana Motherson International Ltd. announced that its subsidiary MSSL Mideast (FZE) will acquire 100% of Yachiyo’s Indian unit, Yachiyo India Manufacturing Pvt. Ltd. Subject to completion of other ongoing conditions precedents for the transaction, the closing is now expected to be completed within March. The current transaction is part of an existing agreement between Motherson and Honda Motor. In July 2023, Samvardhana Motherson entered into an agreement to acquire 81% s...

Schaeffler, Vitesco Technologies to merge in $1.6 billion deal

Schaeffler AG and Vitesco Technologies Group AG have signed a merger agreement, following approval by their respective supervisory boards. The agreement sets out the legally binding terms and conditions for the merger of Vitesco into Schaeffler. The exchange ratio of 11.4 Schaeffler shares per Vitesco share has been confirmed as binding, with Vitesco shareholders receiving 11.4 Schaeffler shares for each Vitesco share they own. The merger agreement is subject to the approval of the respective...

Miovision acquires TTS to enhance traffic flow and safety

Miovision, a company that provides scalable intelligent transportation solutions, has acquired Traffic Technology Services (TTS), a provider of connected vehicle technologies, it said in a press release dated March 4. TTS offers a patented technology that provides real-time "situational awareness" to drivers through their vehicle's instrument panel, helping them optimize their speed to avoid red lights and reduce fuel consumption. With this acquisition, Miovision gains access to TTS's 11 pate...

Vector acquires majority stake in AI and camera-sensor tech firm Eyyes

According to a press release on March 4, Vector has acquired a majority stake in Eyyes GmbH, an Austrian company specializing in AI and camera-sensor technology. Eyyes employs 28 people in Austria and Germany, and is engaged in the field of driver assistance functions and traffic perception with AI based on camera sensors. The company offers warning systems for front collision, approach, reversing, rear-end and turn-off warning as assistance systems, and its products are used in the rail sect...

American Industrial Partners Capital Fund VII completes acquisition of Veoneer

Veoneer announced that the American Industrial Partners Capital Fund VII (AIP Fund VII) has completed the acquisition of the company’s Restraint Control Systems business from SSW Partners LP, in a press release dated March 1. According to the press release, nearly one in every four cars over the past year was equipped with Veoneer's Restraint Control System products, offering protection to vehicle occupants in the event of a traffic accident. The transaction completes Veoneer’s ...

Karma acquires Airbiquity's tech assets to boost software-defined vehicle capabilities

Karma Automotive, an ultraluxury vehicle manufacturer based in Irvine, Calif., has acquired the technology assets and intellectual property (IP) of Airbiquity, a Seattle-based software company specializing in connected vehicle solutions. The acquisition includes key technical employees and significant original equipment manufacturer contracts, and will enable Karma to align its internal resources and increase its focus on software-defined vehicles. Karma President Marques McCammon stated that...

Mercedes-Benz sells stake in Russian truck-maker Kamaz

Mercedes-Benz Group has sold its stake in Russia's largest truck-maker, Kamaz. The German carmaker, which did not disclose the price of the transaction or the buyer, said the deal was completed in February after securing all necessary regulatory approvals, Reuters reported on Feb. 15. Mercedes-Benz AG, which at the time was Daimler AG, took over a 15% stake in Kamaz from Daimler Truck in September 2021 with a view to return it to Daimler Truck after the truck-maker was spun off from the ...

Renesas to acquire Altium for US$5.9 billion, expanding auto design capabilities

Renesas Electronics, a Japanese electronics company, has announced its plan to acquire Altium, an Australian-based electronics design firm, for US$5.9 billion in cash, as reported by Reuters on Feb. 15. The acquisition is expected to enhance Renesas' ability to offer digital device design to its customers, particularly in the automotive industry. Renesas proposed to pay A$68.50 per Altium share, marking a 34% premium over Feb. 14's closing price. The financing will be sourced from existing cash ...

Webasto divests its EV charging business to focus on core business areas

German automotive component supplier Webasto announced Feb. 9 that Los Angeles–headquartered Transom Capital Group will acquire a majority stake in its EV charging solutions business, as part of Webasto’s divestment plan to focus on its core business areas. That said, Webasto said that it, however, plans to remain a minority shareholder in the EV charging business solutions division. The two companies signed a corresponding purchase agreement Feb. 7, Webasto said in its press note. ...

Rane Group announces merger of Rane Brake Lining Ltd. and Rane Engine Valve Ltd. into Rane

Top Indian automotive supplier Rane Group has decided to merge two of its listed companies – Rane Brake Lining and Rane Engine Valve — with its other listed company, Rane (Madras). The proposed reorganisation will bring all operating business subsidiaries under one single company, and it will create a larger company with a combined turnover of rupees 33.73 billion for the trailing 12 months period ended December 31, 2023 (January-December 2023) on a proforma basis, business daily the Hindu B...

Epsilon Advanced Materials completes acquisition of LFP cathode technology center in Germany

Mumbai, India-based lithium-ion (Li-ion) battery materials company Epsilon Advanced Materials (EAM) has finalized the acquisition of Johnson Matthey’s lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cathode active material (CAM) technology center in Moosburg, Germany, it announced Feb. 2. It said that the move makes it the first global company capable of providing manufacturers with both cathode and anode materials for Li-ion batteries. Moreover, it claimed that it is poised to make India the first country in...

TotalEnergies acquires Wenea Group’s EV charging business in Spain

French energy major TotalEnergies has acquired Wenea Group’s electric vehicle charging stations in Spain as part of an agreement to develop high-power EV charging hubs and become a leading charge point operator (CPO) in the region, the company announced Jan. 30. Notably, Wenea group owns and operates 200 EV charging sites in Spain, with all of them located along major highways, and in urban and peri-urban areas. The said EV charging sites draw renewable power, it added. TotalEnergies and...

Hitachi Energy completes acquisition of EV charging equipment-maker COET

Hitachi Energy announced Jan. 10 that it has completed the acquisition of COET, a leading designer and manufacturer of power equipment for electric mobility, and other industries. Hitachi Energy said that the said acquisition was completed on Dec. 28, 2023, following a regulatory approval of the purchase agreement announced earlier in August 2023. Hitachi Energy and COET, a Milan-based company, have had a long-standing collaboration focused on Hitachi Energy’s portfolio of Grid-eMotion high...

Stellantis acquires CloudMade to enable vehicle software development

Stellantis NV announced the acquisition of the AI framework, machine-learning models, and intellectual property rights and patents of CloudMade, a developer of smart and innovative big data-driven automotive solutions. The automaker said in a Jan. 25 press release that the acquisition — as an asset deal — will support the mid-term development of STLA SmartCockpit and reinforce Stellantis’ software strategy outlined in Dare Forward 2030. The AI-powered framework created by CloudMade, ...

Ansys acquires minority stake in Humanetics to enhance human-safety engineering ecosystem

Humanetics and Ansys have entered into a definitive agreement whereby Ansys will acquire a minority stake in Humanetics. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals and is part of an existing partnership between the two companies, as read in a press release on Jan. 23. Humanetics is a leading provider of physical and digital human-safety systems and sensor technologies, including anthropomorphic test devices (ATDs) and innovative ergonomics software solutions. Ansys, a global private e...

Sumitomo Rubber invests in Viaduct for AI-powered fleet management solutions

Sumitomo Rubber Industries has invested in Viaduct, a US-based AI-powered connected vehicle analytics company, to develop total fleet management solutions, according to a press release on Jan. 10. The partnership aims to enhance on-the-road safety, increase vehicle availability and reduce maintenance costs through the combination of Viaduct's AI-based vehicle health solution and Sumitomo Rubber's proprietary sensorless sensing technology. The joint proof-of-concept has already started, and...

ABB acquires R&D engineering firm Meshmind to advance AI and software-driven automation

Tech leader of electrification and automation ABB announced on Jan. 18 that it has agreed to acquire a majority of software service provider Meshmind to expand its research and development capabilities in AI, industrial internet of things and machine vision. Through this acquisition, ABB will integrate engineering talent, AI and software knowledge to form a new global R&D hub to further accelerate the development of innovative automation solutions within its Machine Automation divi...

Synopsys to buy Ansys to emerge as a leader in silicon to systems design solutions

In a mega merger announcement, two large firms Synopsys and Ansys announced that they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Synopsys will acquire Ansys. Under the terms of the agreement, Ansys shareholders will receive $197.00 in cash and 0.3450 shares of Synopsys common stock for each Ansys share, representing an enterprise value of approximately $35 billion based on the closing price of Synopsys common stock on Dec. 21, 2023. Bringing together Synopsys' pioneering semiconduct...

Siemens AG completes acquisition of DC fast-charging solutions company Heliox

Siemens AG has completed the acquisition of DC fast-charging solutions company Heliox, the German technology major announced Jan. 11. Siemens has acquired Heliox from private equity firm Waterland and an entity owned by a group of employees and individual shareholders. Notably, the Netherlands-headquartered Heliox caters to the electric bus and electric truck fleets, and passenger vehicles, and employs approximately 330 people. According to Siemens, the acquisition of Heliox complements it...

Renesas to acquire Transphorm to expand its power portfolio with gallium nitride technology

Renesas Electronics Corp. and Transphorm, a supplier of gallium nitride (GaN) power semiconductors, announced that they have entered into a definitive agreement pursuant to which a subsidiary of Renesas will acquire all outstanding shares of Transphorm’s common stock for $5.10 per share in cash, according to a press release on Jan. 11. The transaction values Transphorm at approximately $339 million. The acquisition will provide Renesas with in-house GaN technology, a key next-generation mat...

CES 2024: Intel announces updates to boost automotive business

At Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2024, Intel announced plans to expand its mobility business. According to a company press release dated Jan. 9, the chipmaker said that it is looking to acquire Silicon Mobility, a fabless silicon and software company specializing in system-on-chips (SoCs) for intelligent electric vehicle energy management. Intel has also revealed a new family of AI-enhanced, software-defined vehicle (SDV) SoCs, with Zeekr as the first original equipment manufacturer to adopt t...

Energy company OMV Petrom plans to become largest EV charging network in Romania by 2026

OMV Petrom, one of the largest integrated energy companies in Southeast Europe, plans to acquire a 50% stake in Electrocentrale Borzesti from RNV Infrastructure, the company announced Jan. 3. Notably, Electrocentrale Borzesti holds an approximately 1-GW capacity of renewable projects, out of which are 950-MW wind and 50-MW photovoltaic. OMV Petrom said that these projects will be further developed, built and operated in partnership with RNV Infrastructure. In addition, OMV Petrom plans to ...

Danlaw Inc. purchase leading vehicle-to-everything technology provider, Cohda Wireless

Danlaw Inc., a renowned pioneer in the field of vehicle-to-everything (V2X) technology, announced the acquisition of Australia-based Cohda Wireless. The company said this is a strategic move that marks a significant milestone in Danlaw’s global expansion initiative, aimed at advancing connected vehicle safety and smart city solutions. The acquisition of Cohda by Danlaw reflects a commitment to innovation, and a shared vision of creating a more connected and safer future for vehicles, c...

Jabil completes divestment of its mobility business to BYD Electronic

Jabil has closed the transaction to divest its Mobility business to BYD Electronic (International) Co., it said in a press release dated Dec. 29, 2023. The consideration is $2.2 billion in cash. The deal was first announced in Sept. 26, 2023. “We are pleased to successfully close this transformational deal and I am confident that this is the right step forward for Jabil. The net proceeds will enable us to enhance our shareholder-centric capital framework, including incremental share buyback...

China Yuchai divests Yuchai Remanufacturing Services unit

China Yuchai International has announced that its main operating subsidiary in China, Guangxi Yuchai Machinery Co. Ltd. (GYMCL), has entered into an agreement with Beijing Liandong Jinyuan Management Technology Co., according to a company press release dated Dec. 31, 2023. According to the agreement, GYMCL’s 100% equity holding in Yuchai Remanufacturing Services (Suzhou) Co. will be sold to Beijing Liandong. The consideration for the transaction is 179.94 million yuan (about $25.4 mill...

Livguard acquires Emuron Technologies

Livguard has acquired Emuron Technologies, a battery swapping and battery-intelligence solutions provider, The Financial Express reported Dec. 20, 2023. Livguard offers services in the field of inverters, automotive batteries, solar solutions and lithium batteries. The acquisition will strengthen the company’s position in the energy transition two- and three-wheelers segment. “We firmly believe that battery swapping will play a pivotal role in accelerating the adoption of electric two- an...

Mobix Labs completes acquisition of EMI Solutions

Mobix Labs, a fabless semiconductor company, has completed the acquisition of EMI Solutions, an Irvine, Calif.-based manufacturer of electromagnetic interference filtering products, according to a press release on Dec. 19. This strategic move allows Mobix Labs to expand its customer base and gain access to new high-reliability (HiRel) markets, as EMI Solutions is recognized as a leading small business manufacturer of EMI filtering products. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. ...

Japan’s Nippon Steel clinches deal to buy US Steel for $14.9 billion

Japan's Nippon Steel has clinched a deal to buy US Steel for $14.9 billion in an auction, which also saw participation from competitors such as including Cleveland-Cliffs, ArcelorMittal and Nucor, according to a news report published by Reuters on December 19. Citing people familiar with the deal, the report said that in a meeting of its board of directors on Sunday, US Steel deemed Nippon's offer superior to a sale to Cleveland-Cliffs, which had raised its bid in the high $40-per-share range...

Samvardhana Motherson to acquire Lumen Group, Deltacarb

Auto components major Samvardhana Motherson International Ltd. (SAMIL) on Dec. 15 announced acquisitions of Australia's Lumen Group and Switzerland's Deltacarb SA for nearly 5.75 billion Indian rupees (about US$469 million), Business Standard reported Dec. 15. The company's board approved the two acquisitions by its wholly-owned arm Samvardhana Motherson Automotive Systems Group BV, SAMIL said in separate regulatory filings. Lumen Group comprises Lumen Australia Pty. Ltd., Lumen Internatio...

Tokyo-based Harmonic Drive Systems to buy back shares after Toyota's stake sale

Tokyo-based Harmonic Drive Systems, a manufacturer of speed reducers, announced Dec. 6 that Toyota Motor will sell its entire stake in the company through an open market overseas sale, Reuters reported Dec. 6. The move has sparked speculation among investors that Toyota may accelerate the sale of its shareholdings in affiliates and partners, following last week's announcement to divest a stake in supplier Denso. The report said Toyota will sell 4,379,400 shares of Harmonic Drive Systems at an...

TMD Friction confirms successful acquisition by Aequita

In a press release announcement on Dec. 5, TMD Friction, a specialist for high-quality brake friction solutions for the automotive and brake industry, has confirmed the successful completion of its acquisition by Aequita, a privately-owned industrial group based in Munich, focused on the acquisition and long-term value enhancement of companies. The company said that the transaction has closed successfully after receiving the required regulatory clearances and approvals from all relevant autho...

TMD Friction, HELLA ink deal for HELLA to acquire 50% share in brake joint venture HELLA Pagid

TMD Friction and HELLA have agreed to transfer the 50% share held by TMD Friction in the brake joint venture (JV) Hella Pagid to HELLA. The two companies signed a letter of intent, with HELLA becoming the sole shareholder of Hella Pagid. Founded in 2013, Hella Pagid sells brake components and accessories on the global automotive aftermarket. The parties have agreed not to disclose the purchase price, said a press release on December 1. HELLA aims to expand sales of brake products under the HE...

Kongsberg Automotive completes the purchase of Skriverform

Zurich-based Kongsberg Automotive AS (KA) has completed the acquisition of 100% of the share capital of Skriverform AS, with the deal being finalized as announced on Nov. 9, 2023. Skriverform, based in Norway, specializes in the design and manufacture of injection molding (IM) tools, a company press release said Nov. 29. According to Linda Nyquist-Evenrud, KA's interim president and CEO, the acquisition aligns with the company's strategic plan to achieve vertical integration, enhance efficien...

Toyota plans to reduce stake in Denso – report
